intro: Mariscus rutilans, commonly known as the golden sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, succulent stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
